revised_title: Observations of the Remarkable Red Lights in the Sky on December 5, 1737
tldr: This article presents a collection of observations of the remarkable red lights seen in the sky on December 5, 1737, from various locations. The phenomenon was observed to spread westward and had a height of about 65 degrees. The cause of the phenomenon is discussed, with various theories proposed, including refraction, a luminous comet, a celestial body, and a mixture of the Earth's and Sun's atmospheres.
